An inequality involving `2`.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : LinearOrderedField α] {a : α}, 2 ≤ a → (1 - 1 / a)⁻¹ ≤ 2
name: sub_one_div_inv_le_two
docString: An inequality involving `2`.

The order of the symbol rotation operation in the dihedral group is 2 for any integer modulo a positive natural number.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} (i : ZMod n), orderOf (DihedralGroup.sr i) = 2
name: DihedralGroup.orderOf_sr
docString: The order of the symbol rotation operation in the dihedral group is 2 for any integer modulo a positive natural number.

The theorem `Real.two_le_pi` states that the number 2 is less than or equal to π, the mathematical constant representing the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter, in real numbers. It formalizes the numerical fact that π, approximately 3.14159265, is indeed greater than 2.

type: 2 ≤ Real.pi
name: Real.two_le_pi
docString: The theorem `Real.two_le_pi` states that the number 2 is less than or equal to π, the mathematical constant representing the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter, in real numbers. It formalizes the numerical fact that π, approximately 3.14159265, is indeed greater than 2.

a second integer

type: {n : ℤ} → CochainComplex.HomComplex.Triplet n → ℤ
name: CochainComplex.HomComplex.Triplet.q
docString: a second integer

A finite field has an even number of elements if and only if its characteristic is 2.

type: ∀ {F : Type u_3} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Fintype F], ringChar F = 2 ↔ Fintype.card F % 2 = 0
name: FiniteField.even_card_iff_char_two
docString: A finite field has an even number of elements if and only if its characteristic is 2.

The theorem states that if `n` is a positive natural number (i.e., `n > 0`), then the cardinality (or the number of elements) of the Dihedral Group `DihedralGroup n` is equal to `2n`. In mathematical terms, the Dihedral Group of order `n` has `2n` elements.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} [inst : NeZero n], Fintype.card (DihedralGroup n) = 2 * n
name: DihedralGroup.card
docString: The theorem states that if `n` is a positive natural number (i.e., `n > 0`), then the cardinality (or the number of elements) of the Dihedral Group `DihedralGroup n` is equal to `2n`. In mathematical terms, the Dihedral Group of order `n` has `2n` elements.

an n-digit number in base b + 2 is less than (b + 2)^n

type: ∀ {b : ℕ} {l : List ℕ}, (∀ x ∈ l, x < b + 2) → Nat.ofDigits (b + 2) l < (b + 2) ^ List.length l
name: Nat.ofDigits_lt_base_pow_length'
docString: an n-digit number in base b + 2 is less than (b + 2)^n

The digits in the base b+2 expansion of n are all less than b+2

type: ∀ {b m d : ℕ}, d ∈ Nat.digits (b + 2) m → d < b + 2
name: Nat.digits_lt_base'
docString: The digits in the base b+2 expansion of n are all less than b+2

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

the condition on the two integers

type: ∀ {n : ℤ} (self : CochainComplex.HomComplex.Triplet n), self.p + n = self.q
name: CochainComplex.HomComplex.Triplet.hpq
docString: the condition on the two integers

Subtraction of two natural numbers.

type: ℕ → ℕ → ℤ
name: Int.subNatNat
docString: Subtraction of two natural numbers.

The 2-morphism filling the triangle diagram.

type:
{B : Type u} →
  [inst : CategoryTheory.Bicategory B] →
    {a b c : B} →
      {f : b ⟶ a} →
        {g : c ⟶ a} →
          (t : CategoryTheory.Bicategory.LeftLift f g) →
            g ⟶ CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.Bicategory.LeftLift.lift t) f
name: CategoryTheory.Bicategory.LeftLift.unit
docString: The 2-morphism filling the triangle diagram.

The cardinal number of a type

type: Type u → Cardinal.{u}
name: Cardinal.mk
docString: The cardinal number of a type

The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication.

type: ∀ {a b x y u v : ℕ}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 → b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 → ∃ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2
name: Nat.sq_add_sq_mul
docString: The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication.

The value of the quadratic character at `2`

type:
∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Fintype F] [inst_2 : DecidableEq F],
  ringChar F ≠ 2 → (quadraticChar F) 2 = ZMod.χ₈ ↑(Fintype.card F)
name: quadraticChar_two
docString: The value of the quadratic character at `2`

The product of two two-pointings.

type: {α : Type u_1} → {β : Type u_2} → TwoPointing α → TwoPointing β → TwoPointing (α × β)
name: TwoPointing.prod
docString: The product of two two-pointings.

`choose n 2` is the `n`-th triangle number.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), Nat.choose n 2 = n * (n - 1) / 2
name: Nat.choose_two_right
docString: `choose n 2` is the `n`-th triangle number.

The digits in the base b expansion of n are all less than b, if b ≥ 2

type: ∀ {b m d : ℕ}, 1 < b → d ∈ Nat.digits b m → d < b
name: Nat.digits_lt_base
docString: The digits in the base b expansion of n are all less than b, if b ≥ 2

Negation of a natural number.

type: ℕ → ℤ
name: Int.negOfNat
docString: Negation of a natural number.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples.

name: Nat.dvd_right_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples.

Two (finite) ℤ-bases have the same discriminant.

type:
∀ (A : Type u) {ι : Type w} [inst : DecidableEq ι] [inst_1 : CommRing A] [inst_2 : Fintype ι] (b b' : Basis ι ℤ A),
  Algebra.discr ℤ ⇑b = Algebra.discr ℤ ⇑b'
name: Algebra.discr_eq_discr
docString: Two (finite) ℤ-bases have the same discriminant.

The Mersenne numbers, 2^p - 1.

type: ℕ → ℕ
name: mersenne
docString: The Mersenne numbers, 2^p - 1.

the isomorphism corresponding to a 2-commutative diagram

type:
{C₁ : Type u_1} →
  {C₂ : Type u_2} →
    {C₃ : Type u_3} →
      {C₄ : Type u_4} →
        [inst : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_7, u_1} C₁] →
          [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_8, u_2} C₂] →
            [inst_2 : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_9, u_3} C₃] →
              [inst_3 : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_10, u_4} C₄] →
                {T : CategoryTheory.Functor C₁ C₂} →
                  {L : CategoryTheory.Functor C₁ C₃} →
                    {R : CategoryTheory.Functor C₂ C₄} →
                      {B : CategoryTheory.Functor C₃ C₄} →
                        [self : CategoryTheory.CatCommSq T L R B] →
                          CategoryTheory.Functor.comp T R ≅ CategoryTheory.Functor.comp L B
name: CategoryTheory.CatCommSq.iso'
docString: the isomorphism corresponding to a 2-commutative diagram

Turns a two-pointing into a two-pointed type.

type: {X : Type u_3} → TwoPointing X → TwoP
name: TwoP.of
docString: Turns a two-pointing into a two-pointed type.
